programme.title: Deadliest Place On Earth
programme.desc: Australia is known for its abundance of strange and wonderful animals. But hiding in the ocean, the outback and even the backyard are animals with deadly intentions.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett build a giant bar aquarium for the owners of Creek Casino in Alabama. This tank marks ATMs 10,000th tank and is one of the largest theyve ever built.

programme.title: Natures Strangest Mysteries: Solved
programme.desc: Experts examine footage of crows leaving gifts in Seattle. Plus, could a shark really be older than America? And, what is making crop circles in the sea?

programme.title: Natures Strangest Mysteries: Solved
programme.desc: What happens when a zebra has no stripes and why goats would risk their lives to climb an almost vertical wall.

programme.title: Natures Strangest Mysteries: Solved
programme.desc: Why a pair of giraffes have turned white in Kenya and why the worlds fastest land animal is not always successful when hunting.

programme.title: Natures Strangest Mysteries: Solved
programme.desc: How do bats avoid bumping into each other in the middle of the night? Why did a bottlenose dolphin seek out a divers help? Experts examine this and more!

programme.title: Shallow Water Invasion
programme.desc: Using a self-propelled shark cage called The Explorer, marine biologists Mauricio Hoyos and Grant Johnson will investigate great whites moving into shallow waters at night.

programme.title: Deadliest Place On Earth
programme.desc: Australia is known for its abundance of strange and wonderful animals. But hiding in the ocean, the outback and even the backyard are animals with deadly intentions.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson makes his way to Brooklyn, where a couple are seeing their relationship suffer over the ongoing blood feud between their two cats.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: After a string of bad luck with some of the parolees, Tia hopes newbie Richard will prove to be a valuable asset. Plus, the team rushes to save a mutilated pup.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: The family reminisces about the dogs that hold a special place in their hearts. If it werent for these dogs, none of them would be where they are today.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: A couple is torn between two dogs and cant decide who to bring home with them. And, a local stray is in dire need of medical attention, but afraid of humans.

programme.title: The Bronx Zoo
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes at the Bronx Zoo. The ingenuity of zoo staff is put to the test as they devise a treatment for a new-born snow leopard cub struggling to walk.

programme.title: The Bronx Zoo
programme.desc: 26-year old polar bear, Tundra, is one of the zoos favourite inhabitants. But, after his behaviour changes, keepers are worried about signs of disease.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff treats a puppy suffering from a deadly virus. And, he must gain the trust of rescued wolves to help an ailing member of the pack.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff treats a dog with a mysterious injury, while a neglected turtle needs a new home. Plus, the team falls in love with a litter of stray kittens.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert takes on the challenge of relocating Bosco, the zoos most aggressive croc. Terri helps Harley the koala find love after a tough breeding season.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert gets set to swim with Gloria, a huge reticulated python, for the first time in the Crocoseum. Plus, Bindi welcomes home two orphaned kangaroo joeys.

programme.title: The Aquarium
programme.desc: The dive team have a tricky job adding a large fixture into a tank. And, the vets fix a penguins broken leg - will he recover and get released into the wild?

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Moe and Lizzy rescue a sick stray, but a diagnosis proves tricky. Meanwhile, new mom Tania struggles to find a balance between life and work at Villalobos.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson must figure out what is triggering his next felines aggressive behavior. A crazed cat is enraged by her owners roommate. Meanwhile, a newlywed couple is concerned after their two cats behavior suddenly becomes unruly.

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Lucas revisits five of his favourite builds and families. He and his team reveal their never-before-seen, most outrageous backyard creations.

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Lucas builds a giant pool for a friend. He creates a dream backyard with a dock, large cascading waterfalls, firepit and an audio-visual entertainment swim-up bar!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How do caterpillars transform into magnificent butterflies in their cocoon? Plus, why are cats tongues the way they are? Experts answer these questions and more!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Why are some cats cross-eyed? How do meerkats eat poisonous scorpions and how can hippos sleep whilst holding their breath? Experts answer these questions and more!

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Discover how dogs have evolved from wild predators to friendly pets. Plus, a look at parts of the world where dogs are spoiled as much as children.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The guys are in Indiana, tasked with one of the biggest shark tanks theyve ever built, housing over 100 fish and two species of shark. Moving it is not an easy ride!

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: WWE Superstar Chris Jericho wants a large aquarium with a replica championship belt and List of Jericho. Will Brett and Wayde be victorious or put on the list?

programme.title: In Search Of Monsters
programme.desc: Experts discuss theories related to the worlds most famous cryptid, Bigfoot. Recently uncovered evidence unveils a creature far fiercer than previously believed.

programme.title: How Sharks Hunt
programme.desc: Examine the hunting approaches of tiger sharks and great whites, namely the polaris breach, aerial breach and surface broach. What makes these killer strategies so effective?

programme.title: Saved By The Barn
programme.desc: As Spring arrives in Michigan, the Barn Sanctuary prepares to open for all animals. Plus, Dan and Kelly come to the rescue of a lamb in desperate need of medical care.

programme.title: Meet The Penguins
programme.desc: A wild penguin receives treatment for a life-or-death wound, two home-pen inhabitants get into a nasty fight and one of the long-term residents celebrates a special occasion!

programme.title: Meet The Penguins
programme.desc: The odds are stacked against an undersized, abandoned chick. At almost four months Little Bluey weighs just over a kilo. The team do all they can - but will it be enough?

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: Donna Stepan runs Sleepy Burrow Wombat Sanctuary. When she takes in a new orphaned baby in critical condition, the next 24 hours become a fight for its life.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Discover how dogs have evolved from wild predators to friendly pets. Plus, a look at parts of the world where dogs are spoiled as much as children.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Brown family of nine hatches a plan to deal with a lumber shortage, but then a sudden injury threatens to split the family apart.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns look to protect the newest family member from bears now seeking food on Chichagof Island. Matt races for his life as he tries returning home.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How do caterpillars transform into magnificent butterflies in their cocoon? Plus, why are cats tongues the way they are? Experts answer these questions and more!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Why are some cats cross-eyed? How do meerkats eat poisonous scorpions and how can hippos sleep whilst holding their breath? Experts answer these questions and more!

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigators join forces with Texas police officers in an attempt to smash one of the biggest dog fighting rings in US history.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: When investigators from the Houston SPCA respond to a call at a livery stable they find themselves in a life or death battle to save a severely neglected horse.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: When a dog is found with a tumour hanging from his neck, investigators battle to save him. In court, they have to win custody of the dog so he can receive treatment.

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: School is in full swing and in just a few months the students will be doctors. Adding to the stress they must first pass their final rotations.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: The team searches the Nevada desert for the camel spider. This eight-legged terror has two pairs of jaws and is the fastest arachnid on the planet.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: The team scours a dangerous Thai rainforest to track down the stunningly coloured tokay gecko. Its gravity-defying adhesive abilities defy logic - and gravity.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: When Dr. Jeff examines a beloved Weimaraner who has stopped eating, he makes a surprising discovery; Dr. Baier investigates the cause of a pet rabbits mysterious fur loss; a servicewoman asks Dr. Jeff for help with her Pit Bulls injured leg.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff helps a dog with a serious illness. Mel and her daughter rescue a baby squirrel, while Dr. Jeff and Dr. Petra team up to save a beloved cat hit by a car.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri returns to her hometown in Oregon to help Brady, a cougar in need of a health check. At the zoo, Bindi bathes an echidna with bad skin allergies.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri helps prepare the zoos new baby rhino for a life-saving vaccine. Robert is on a rescue mission to save two black swans in bad shape.

programme.title: The Aquarium
programme.desc: Two African penguins, Freya and Neo, welcome a young chick, but then health problems arise. Staff work to train a trio of harbor seals to ride the elevator, with the only hiccup being a nervous seal named Floyd.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: The rescue team begin Operation Rhino, hoping to place a long-term shelter resident in a fantastic home. Plus, two dogs need rescuing in the French Quarter.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Dorothy and Traviss cat vomits out of anger, and attacks them. They are afraid their son will be her next victim. Jackson will need all his experience to deal with this feline.

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: On his first collaboration with a local design team, Lucas creates a tropical oasis. It features an island, a huge grotto rock and a Tiki-themed cabana!

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Lucas remodels an unusable pool for a famous golfing family. He creates an ocean-themed pool with fire features, an infinity edge and his first water couch!

programme.title: Extinct Or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest tracks clues and eyewitness accounts that suggest the Formosan Clouded Leopard, which was declared extinct only recently, could still be alive.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: World famous DJ Steve Aoki wants to get Tanked! But this job will be way harder than pressing play, Steve wants a custom, 3-headed dragon on the verge of escape inside his tank! The guys have to make sure this job is as outrageous as the DJ himself!

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Actress, activist, and entrepreneur Alyssa Milano tasks Wayde and Brett with making a tank for her family - an elegant aquarium with a built-in wine rack.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Famous filmmaker, Kevin Smith, needs a new home for his two turtles and one tortoise. Can Brett and Wayde build a tank to house both species?

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: Four groups of ordinary people are dropped into the remote wilderness of Alaska by bush pilot and survival expert Paul Claus. As each group struggles to find their new home in the wild they must overcome bears, glaciers and their fears.

programme.title: Animal ER
programme.desc: Owners Lisa and Callu are worried about Merlin, a Great Dane who goes over on his front toes when he walks. Neurologist Annette Wessman suspects a problem in his spine or skull.

programme.title: Saved By The Barn
programme.desc: A cow called Buttercup comes to the barn, but the team is concerned about her feisty behaviour. And, Ginger the lamb battles a life-threatening infection.

programme.title: Gamechangers: Inventing The World
programme.desc: Two technology entrepreneurs harness the power of solar energy to solve two different problems: water contamination in Ghana and jungle preservation in South America.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: Theresa and Tony "Scruff" Matthews turned their retirement home in Australia into a kangaroo rescue and are releasing three back into the wild.

programme.title: Bad Dog
programme.desc: Features a cat that has too much catnip and knocks over the Christmas tree, a dog that ends up inside a toaster oven and a pet skunk that always gets her way.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: As the Wolfpack race to build a new "Boomtown" inspired basecamp, an unexpected tragedy strikes, and the family must grieve one of its own.

programme.desc: Bugs, Lola, Daffy, Porky and Tweety utilise their vehicles to tackle construction projects, all the while acquiring valuable insights.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by Penelope Pussycat to build a fashion runway in France where they are encouraged to make their design bigger and more fun.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Chef Poyung Panda hires The Looney Builders to build her a Dim Sum bus in China, but the crew faces a major setback and Bugs worries about letting down his favourite chef.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: As The Looney Builders build a giant claw game for Chibi Critter’s arcade in Japan, they discover the claw part is broken.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: In Catsylvania, a strange flying bug bites Tom, transforming him into a Tom-sized bug monster. Van Mouseling saves the village with an old-fashioned canister of bug poison, and Tom flies off to the abandoned castle on the hill. But Toms troubles arent over yet! Inside, he must deal with huge spider webs and a spider the size of a truck.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: While mopping the kitchen floor, Tom uses an odd-looking sponge on a plate to clean up the mess. But the "sponge" turns out to be a rare truffle, which the estates new pig ate. To pacify Cates, Tom and Jerry must find out whether the animal is also good at hunting truffles.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ginger places her grannys old cuckoo clock in the hall, and it still works! However, the newly arrived clock causes issues when Tom wants to catch the tiny wooden bird inside and Tuffy wants to befriend it.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: At midnight, a gothic lady cat appears with her favorite sinister plant creatures including her personal favorite: Fang, a big man-eating plant. As long as its sealed in the hothouse, nothing can go wrong. But Tom, Jerry and Tuffy soon have their hands full with the escaped plant.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Cates appears and assigns Tom the job of sweeping the estates chimneys, warning him not to upset the Duchesss new exotic pet bird. Unfortunately, both the pet bird and a stork at the top of the chimney think Jerry is a worm. Soon chaos breaks out, hurting Toms cleaning efforts.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Tom finds out he won a contest to be in a cat food commercial, his behavior turns smug. This irritates Jerry, who goes to great lengths to ruin the commercial shoot at the house as Tom struggles in his role.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Tilly is dressed as her alter-ego, SuperTilly – the greatest superhero in the universe. It’s SuperTilly to the rescue!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy promised his uncle to water his plants while he is away. When he finally heads to the greenhouse, he discovers that the watering system he built is broken. The plants are not doing well. The gang resorts to watering the plants with a hose!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Glitchs compartment empties out and a huge amount of junk floats out, Ella suggests that Slippy get rid of it. They all head to Vesta. Madhu finds something that looks like a robot so the gang sets out to find the other pieces.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella, Tilly, Slippy and Madhu are playing a game on the moon when it starts to rumble. The ground cracks open, and they fall into what they discover is a large network of tunnels underground.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Angelie breaks Slippys Jupiter gliding record, hes equally upset and fascinated by her surfboard. The two agree on a rematch and set out to work on their vehicles. They both ask Ella for help.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad’s violin recital is interrupted by the leaks from his roof. When Toad tries to fix it, he discovers the leaks have given him a musical bonus.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Smudge wins Chief’s offer of being Chief for a day and proposes to deface the statue of Toad outside Toad Hall as a futile gesture to rile Toad! However Toad loves the modernistic approach to his statue and resolves to track down the unknown artist.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its a stormy day, and Toad ignores Rattys instructions to tie the sail down. The sail takes off, taking Ratty, Mole, and Hedge with it. Toad has to take to the skies himself in order to save his friends.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its time for Adder to shed her itchy skin, but the other Riverbankers fail to understand why she is so grumpy and continually interrupt her peace and quiet.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Ratty and his brother, Reggie, take Toads caravan on a trip through the countryside, sibling jealousies rise to the surface.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The nasty tennis player is big and angry and wants his ball back. The one Mr. Bean managed to throw on the roof of a house across the road.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Eating too many sweets gives Bean a terrible toothache, and when all other attempts at curing it are exhausted, he reluctantly visits the dreaded dentist.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: After (accidentally) rescuing a kitten from a tree Mr. Bean is set to have his picture in the newspaper!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but can’t escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Bean’s mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: The Wild West was full of gambling, frenzied gold rushes and legendary racketeers. It was a lawless age when people wanted two things: money and a good time.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: On alien planets, they rain from the sky as scalding iron. Theyre so rare in the Universe, they almost dont exist, but these are the magical liquids of our Liquid Universe.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The gods worshipped by the Norse Vikings were fearsome and mysterious. Experts investigate whether these powerful Viking Gods could have been visitors from another planet.

programme.title: Search For The Lost Giants
programme.desc: The Viera brothers travel to the Ozarks and make two possibly game-changing discoveries.

programme.title: Chasing Mummies
programme.desc: Zahi wants to see if the long-forgotten Falcon Galleries can be restored as a new tourist destination. Inside, not only are there thousands of mummified birds, but deadly snakes and scorpions, too!

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: Terry Schappert reveals why the Vikings were called the "Hells Angels of the Middle Ages". He tests the weapons and tactics used to pillage Europe. They pillage Europe, but they meet their match--the Saxons--at the Battle of Maldon.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: In the opening episode, the pair tackle the River Forth in the shadow of Stirling Castle. In the first archaeological river search of this spot, they set out on the hunt for relics of Scotlands greatest medieval warriors, William Wallace and Robert the Bruce, revealing secrets from the battle sites of their most famous victories against their hated English overlords.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: Bigfoot, Loch Ness Monster, killer beasts on land and sea? Are these myths, legends, folklore or real monsters lurking in the world around us?

programme.desc: The team uncovers shocking evidence of a web of underground tunnels connecting the homes of key players in Kevins theory, offering possible proof that members of the 4th Michigan Cavalry returned home with millions in Confederate gold.

programme.title: The Hunt For Baltic Gold
programme.desc: For thousands of years, amber has continued to be the object of desire for hunters roaming the stormy seaside. This series tells the story of the Polish people who live and breathe amber in their everyday lives.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: In the closing months of WWII, legend has it that the Japanese buried something of immense value deep in the Philippine jungle. A group of investigators and engineers are using the latest technology to search for the treasure and the truth.

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: Ancient Top 10 is a smart, fun countdown that details how ancient technology worked, how surprisingly advanced it was, and how it was kind of awesome!

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigate the facts and myths surrounding UFO sightings in every corner of the world. Examine evidence and eyewitness accounts and explore the mystery of what happened or what didnt happen.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: ‘Missing in Alaska’ investigates the region of northwest Alaska, where over 20,000 people have vanished in an area locals call the Alaska Triangle. In all these cases, the bodies are rarely discovered. Who or whats behind these cases is unknown.

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: ‘Warriors’ delves deep into the warrior mindset: the rites of passage, the initiations and the rituals, which reveal what makes them rise above the rest of humankind to lead, to fight, and in some cases, to die.

programme.title: Food Tech
programme.desc: Bobby Bognar, a food industry veteran, travels the world deconstructing favourite meals. Along the way he reveals the hidden world behind every bite, sees first-hand how ingredients from around the globe come together to become the meals we love.

programme.title: Serial Killer Earth
programme.desc: With the aid of a team of experts and eyewitness testimony, ‘Serial Killer Earth’ delves deep into the destructive power of natural disasters, and in the process explains how they compare with natural disasters of the past.

programme.title: The Hunt For Baltic Gold
programme.desc: For thousands of years, amber has continued to be the object of desire for hunters roaming the stormy seaside. This series tells the story of the Polish people who live and breathe amber in their everyday lives.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: In the closing months of WWII, legend has it that the Japanese buried something of immense value deep in the Philippine jungle. A group of investigators and engineers are using the latest technology to search for the treasure and the truth.

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: Ancient Top 10 is a smart, fun countdown that details how ancient technology worked, how surprisingly advanced it was, and how it was kind of awesome!

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigate the facts and myths surrounding UFO sightings in every corner of the world. Examine evidence and eyewitness accounts and explore the mystery of what happened or what didnt happen.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: ‘Missing in Alaska’ investigates the region of northwest Alaska, where over 20,000 people have vanished in an area locals call the Alaska Triangle. In all these cases, the bodies are rarely discovered. Who or whats behind these cases is unknown.

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: ‘Warriors’ delves deep into the warrior mindset: the rites of passage, the initiations and the rituals, which reveal what makes them rise above the rest of humankind to lead, to fight, and in some cases, to die.

programme.title: Food Tech
programme.desc: Bobby Bognar, a food industry veteran, travels the world deconstructing favourite meals. Along the way he reveals the hidden world behind every bite, sees first-hand how ingredients from around the globe come together to become the meals we love.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: A miraculous meteorite falling from the heavens. A priceless gemstone with a deadly curse. And a chunk of sandstone considered so sacred that wars have been fought to protect it. What is it about stones that inspires some people to worship them?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick takes a trip down the rabbit hole after a seller hops in with a first edition of "Alices Adventures in Wonderland." Will it make Rick grin like the Cheshire Cat, or drive him mad?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller whips into the shop with an "Energy Dome" hat made for the band DEVO, will Ricks offer top the charts? And later, Ricks intrigued by a signed George Washington letter. But will the asking price cause him to start a rebellion?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Counting down the top ten mysteries of the deep, from sunken continents to ruins on the ocean floor and even artifacts that may be remnants of Atlantis. Could these mysteries provide a record of extraterrestrial visitation?

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Are reports of a strange swirling vortex with a brilliant white center in the skies over Oklahoma proof of a genuine UFO? Does a video claimed to be discovered sealed in Vatican archives, show a real case of demonic possession?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In August of 2014, Russian cosmonauts aboard the International Space Station discovered something incredibly unexpected covering parts of the windows - living sea plankton. If sea life can thrive in space, might the reverse be true as well?

programme.desc: When the team launches an illuminated swarm of drones on Skinwalker Ranch, they are stunned by a series of mysterious events.

programme.desc: On a California dream pick, the competitive pinball-wizard Wolfe brothers meet coin-op king Dirk at his giant poultry barn turned private arcade.

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.desc: A set of replica Muppets has Chum green with envy; Will going gonzo over these furry friends land him the goods? When a pair of pants supposedly worn by Keith Richards rolls into the shop, Corey teaches Jake you cant always get what you want.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Spring is coming and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are very brave and go on a journey through the meadow to discover the source of a mysterious – and slightly spooky - creaking sound. They follow the clues to discover… it’s the frozen lake melting, and singing as it does!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse pick lots of delicious strawberries. Little Nutbrown Hare eats all his and runs out so Little Field Mouse shares hers with him. When he goes to collect some more for his friend he eats them all too. Little Field Mouse shows him how to eat them really slowly to make them last longer.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and Finlay can hear some scary noises in the Nursery. Who is making the scary sounds?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Something knocks Sgt. Murphy’s hat off his head, chops the tops of Baker Humperdink’s baguettes, and sheers a path through a flower bed. Although no one saw anything, they all heard it make the same whoop whoop whoop sound. Putting the clues together, Huckle, Sally and Lowly figure out that it was Vanderbuilt’s new, out of control, boomerang./The mysterious disappearance of Mayor Fox leaves Huckle and the gang on an important search.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is in the kitchen preparing his breakfast. In this instance, just like most others, it’s a plateful of socks. Before he tucks in, he notices the fridge door is open. He jumps down from the breakfast table to shut it. “How do these things stick to the fridge?” he says looking at the collection of colourful magnets. “What are they? Why don’t they fall off? It’s like magic?” He vortexes himself to Okido to find out. He joins Zoe and Felix in the garden, who are busy packing things to take with them to the beach. At the command of Messy’s whistle, Okidoodle whizzes out of the garage and they’re on their way.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, it’s a hot sunny day and Messy is playing outside in the sand pit. He tries to make some shade to cool himself down but in the process his ice lolly disappears! He wonders where it could have so he goes to Okido to find out. He lands with a soft, crunchy thud and looks around - thick white snow is everywhere! He finds Zoe and Felix in the garden who invite him to come and play in the park. Zoe and Felix decide to make “the biggest snowman Okido has EVER seen’’. Messy gets distracted by some giant footprints. He follows the trail and finds a large friendly snow creature called Snowden!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When the girls discover that Apples groove booties can teach the pups to dance, Plum gets an idea for a Doggie Dance Show. Wanting to impress them, Huck offers to have TomTom join the show... despite the pups obvious dislike of performing in public. Its up to Strawberry to help Huck see that he should not force TomTom into something he just doesnt want to do.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry cant find one of his red cowboy socks - the ones with a white fringe.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Charlie lends Harry her Sergeant Shout toy for the weekend, Harry promises not to let it leave in his bedroom.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari was backpacking through the forest where she discovers a bunch of discarded leaves and branches on the floor due to the aftermath of the storm. As she investigate further, the wind blows a paper cup near her. Zari was perplexed as she mistaken the insect with an actual leaf, causing her to call in the Rangers. Back at the headquarters, Leo is searching for Hero and Katie as theyre playing hide And seek. As Leo is struggling to find Katie, he receives a call from Zari, who asks for help with the strange animal. Leo and Katie travels with PlatypusOne to reach Zari. As they arrived, Zari tells them to be careful because the leaves on the ground could be a Malayan Leaf insect too. After carefully going investigate and not finding any, the wind manage to blow the Malayan Leaf insect out of Katies hand. Leo chases it down with his jetpack, manage to safe the animal from harm. The gang then tries to find a proper place for the insect. They then stumble a new location, where a mouse-deer is nearby. Leo put the insect on a high branch, when suddenly they got greeted by Ranger Rocky. He then calls for Ranger Joey for more information on the Malayan Leaf Insect, where she fully explains its habitat and predators that may appear. She advices them that the mouse-deer might mistake the insect as an actual leaf and would eat it, where Leo take the advice and put the insect somewhere higher on the trees. The Rangers went home where Leo put the Malayan Leaf insect photo on the wall. He then figured to look for Katie and hero to continue their game earlier, but Katie and Hero was already inside the treehouse, indifferent to Leos game. Ranger Rocky finally thanks them for a great job on the computer screen.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In India, Thomas encourages Shankar to enter a costume contest, but Shankar doesnt feel comfortable being in the spotlight.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Nia is delighted to be transporting an elephant to the animal park - but her passenger is less happy about it

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu has promised Mr. Toramento to help him clean up the beach. The problem is that he has more important things to do, like taking the fire truck ride that David promised him. Or even more urgently, helping his firefighting heroes find the fire truck keys that David lost. So, he messes up his work, until he realizes that its better to do things right. At the end he eventually finds the keys and gets his fire truck ride.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu wants to set up a special birthday party for Fume at the pizzeria, and to offer him his favorite pizza. Unfortunately, Mr. Guellec has hurt his arm and he cant harvest the tomatoes that the pizza sauce requires. With Stellas help, Grisu turns into a farmer but its not an easy task to harvest Guellecs high tomato plants for such a tiny dragon. Fortunately, Grisu has plenty of ideas: if you cant reach the tomatoes, try to make the tomatoes reaching you!And after having burnt the cart he needs to deliver the tomatoes in time, Grisu finds a way to achieve his mission by creating the first rolling catamaran!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Summer is at its hottest and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse want to run and play but the sun is just too hot and strong. That’s until Little Grey Squirrel gives them both a wonderful present, big leafy parasols. When he later changes his mind and takes Little Nutbrown Hare’s parasol back, the little hare is naturally disappointed. Can the friends find a way for all of them to be happy?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: You Summer in the meadow is a great time to find tasty snacks to eat. Big Nutbrown Hare seems to know all the best tricks and hiding spots for the yummy treats and Little Nutbrown Hare can’t help but wish he was as big and smart as his father. However, he soon finds out that there are some things a little Nutbrown Hare can teach a Big Nutbrown Hare.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Loudo invites Scoutbadger, Rosie and Woodsy to a party. It makes Woodsy so happy that, out of joy, he jumps on a pile of wood and hurts his foot. There is only one solution for Margaret and Edmund: Woodsy can’t walk for a while, and that means he can’t go to the party. The same stands for Scoutbadger whomust stay with his brother to help him out, as he cannot move.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: While working at Fixham Campsite, Dizzy wants to camp out with Leo and the Spring City Rockets till she’s put off by the creepy crawlies. She later regrets her decision and returns with Scoop and Muck but they are frightened by the spooky story Leo is telling and the Rockets think they are the creatures from his story. Everyone panics and the build is damaged as they flee. Dizzy gets her wheel stuck in a ditch and is left behind.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Sports guru Skye Sampson asks Bob to build a 100 metre zip-line for her new fitness program. Its a job that Leo should love to help with, but he seems very distracted. Leo is put in charge of finishing the launch platform and fixing the zip-line, but he keeps making mistakes and wonders if he is up to the job. Lofty tries to convince Leo of how well theyre doing, but when the zip-line comes loose its the last straw. Leo says he should give up being a builder. Scoop and Lofty panic that Leo is going to leave the team – they decide they must make things right! But in their attempts to fix the platform they end up demolishing it instead.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids search for the owner of a sketchbook that contains drawings done from a high point of view. After determining the artist wasnt drawing at the top of a ladder or up in a tree, they discover the sketchbook belongs to one of Busytowns tallest residents, Jeremy Giraffe. / Huckle and gang investigate a strange temperature drop which turns Busytowns summer to winter.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Farah preparing her morning and setting up her portable radio, she later stumbles upon a little kitten with black-lined ears mewing and walking around aimlessly. Looking for its mother, Farah realizes the kitten is lost and calls for help. Back in the garden, Leo is finishing up a birdhouse before Katie joins him. Katie suggests and puts in some seeds. Instead of a bird, Hero runs in chasing a baby squirrel and the squirrel gets into the birdhouse while Hero barks excitedly. Leo receives a call from Farah who tells Leo and Katie about a lost kitten. The rangers head up to the treehouse to learn more about it before agreeing to help her find the kittens mother. Leo, Katie And Hero arrives and find Farah in the forest with the kitten, still mewing restlessly. The rangers conclude the kitten may be looking for its mum, the rangers embark on a journey to help find the mum. They want to leave the clearings to find the kitten’s mum, but the kitten finds the children threatening so it hides away inside a bush nearby. The ranger manage to climb the kitten by giving it a squeaking toy to calm it down.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle is nonchalantly playing with his boomerang in the Australian forest. But when it suddenly didnt came back, Kyle finds it behind a thick push. It turns out the boomerang has led him to a strange injured animal trapped inside a cage, accompanied with some blood and bandage in the cage. He felt worried so he calls in the Junior Ranger for help. Back in the garden, Hero finds a small branch with leaves and wanted to play fetch with Leo. Leo sees that theres an animal on the stick, to which Katie reveals that its a pupa and will transform into a butterfly. Then Leo receives a call where they later the animal is Pygmy Tarsier in the treehouse. The Junior Rangers agrees to help and ride PlatypusOne to meet up with Kyle. Once theyre there, they planned to help find the Pygmy Tarsier to a safe place for its to rest but Kyle opens up the cage as he was hypnotized by the animals eyes. The animal scrams away, causing the Rangers to go after it. The animal try to climb the tree but is unable because its hurt, and cant be approach by as it would trigger the animal to act hostile. Leo comes a plan and acts like a monkey to calm it down, to which it actually succeed.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simons parents have invited some of their friends and their son Maxime over for the evening. Maxime doesnt want to play, so Simon does everything that he can to get him to do so!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The boys resent the girls for not telling them what Christmas surprise they have in mind for the night. But all things go well, when the surprise is revealed and their old friend, the Stargirl takes them on a magical ride on her starship in the clear night sky.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Zephyr and Leapy decide to make a little surprise box for Dr Owls most beloved belongings. They want to decorate the box with shells, so the Robin flies them to the seashore to collect the most beautiful shells. They even get some help from the Crab, and get a ride back home on a back of a turtle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: During Christmas, Dr Owl gets sick, and Bubbles cant seem to wrap his head around the fact that doctors can also get sick. Flutter helps him understand that the car of a car mechanic can also break down, and the shoe of a cobbler can also get torn sometimes. So the friends make a beautiful surprise for the old doctor.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, something special they can all do and Bing gets frustrated when his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda launches an herbal delivery service, and demand is huge. But Billy and Benny mix up orders: now Rupert cant sleep, and Robin sleeps through his morning song. Tilda must fix the chaos.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds soapbox cars, and Billy and Benny race them excitedly. Edna thinks its too dangerous and secures the track, while Karl and Molly struggle with near-sightedness and fear.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda and Rupert are on a boat trip when they suddenly find themselves stranded on dry land. Where has the water gone? They meet Berta, the beaver girl, and discover her dam is the cause.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: You Summer in the meadow is a great time to find tasty snacks to eat. Big Nutbrown Hare seems to know all the best tricks and hiding spots for the yummy treats and Little Nutbrown Hare can’t help but wish he was as big and smart as his father. However, he soon finds out that there are some things a little Nutbrown Hare can teach a Big Nutbrown Hare.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On Summer’s hottest night Little Nutbrown Hare finds it hard to sleep. When a swim in the river isn’t enough to cool him down, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends ask Little White Owl to tell them a really cold and sleepy bedtime story. Will she come up with a story that can make them feel cool and finally get Little Nutbrown Hare off to sleep?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is impressed by Blue Bird’s description of a flowery field that looks just like a sea of colour from her bird’s eye view. He visits the field with Big Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, and they discover that everyone has their own unique view of the field, and each one is special in its own way.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard play superheroes, challenging each other to find out who is the strongest superhero in the world: Is it SuperRabbit or Captain Rabbit?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In a Chinese forest, Kai discovers an intriguing gibbon call on his audio device but is interrupted by a persistent buzzing sound. Meanwhile, Leo practices drumming in the garden, disturbing Katie and Hero’s peace. Katie later identifies the source of the buzzing as cicadas, prompting the team to embark on a mission to help a lonely cicada find a mate much to Kai’s hesitance. With the guidance of Ranger Rocky and Ranger Joey, they amplify the cicadas call using Kai’s Kaizer, leading to comical chaos as the cicada gets too close to Kai - who is afraid of bugs. They decide to repeat the same plan of amplifying the cicada’s buzz but this time, using PlatypusOne (so that no one has to get close to the cicada). The buzzing from PlatypusOne gets really loud, making it hard for the rangers to hear themselves, and misdirecting the female cicada to PlatypusOne instead of the male cicada but eventually, Hero saves the day by turning off the sound, allowing the cicadas to find each other. The team celebrates their success back in the garden, as Leo offers to teach Hero how to drum but Hero runs off, and Katie hints that Hero might not enjoy Leo’s drumming after all. Ranger Rocky commends the Junior Rangers for their efforts.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the African shrublands, Jane and Zumi discover a peculiar animal, an Aardvark, restless during the day. Leo is looking for his grabber in the Garden and asks Katie and Hero if they saw it and Hero ends up acting suspicious. They get a call from Jane about the Aardvark and with the computer, Leo and Katie help identify the creature and learn about its nocturnal habits which concerns the rangers since it is currently out during the day. Leo, Katie and Hero fly to Jane and Zumi to figure out this mystery. However, when they arrive, the Aardvark runs off, prompting the Junior Rangers to instruct Zumi to track it down. They catch up to Zumi and the Aardvark as it starts eating ants from an anthill before it starts making a move again. The rangers follow and it leads them to its burrow but strangely enough, it goes in and comes out quickly much to the rangers’ confusion. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey and learn more about the aardvark. The aardvark enters the burrow again before coming out really quickly and sprinting off. Suddenly, python pops out from the burrow, answering their curiosities.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees must compare loads to determine which are heavier and which are lighter. It looks like Brewster’s got it wrong when he says his second load is heavier than his first – the loads weight exactly the same. But then a stowaway is discovered in the second load - Peckham! It turns out Brewster was right after all – Peckham’s added weight means the second load was heavier!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, Koko and Brewster have to wash some dirty cars using the Chugwash. Koko will bring the cars to Brewster, who will put them through the wash. Koko is impatient and delivers the cars too quickly. Brewster is overly careful about washing them and goes too slowly, getting behind. They both realise their mistakes and work as a team to get the job done properly.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out walking in the forest, Benedicte sets a challenge for Tchoupi and Nina – to find their way back home all by themselves, using landmarks they come across along the way. But when they spot a squirrel, they momentarily forget to pay attention, and stray from the path back home...

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Loupiote the dog is feeling particularly playful this morning! She grabs T’choupi’s stuffed and runs off to bury it in a secret location! T’choupi manages to get his plush bear back… but its fur is covered in mud! Dad washes it… but now it’s all wet and will never be dry by tonight! Tchoupi feels down: how will he be able to sleep without his precious teddy bear?! He sets off on a quest to find a replacement… but comes back empty-handed. Nina thinks she just may have a solution: what if she were to teach him how to get to sleep… “Teddy-less?...!”

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Luce are awe - struck when they find out that Ciboulette the cat has just had kittens! Dad asks them to leave the babies alone as they need peace and quiet in order to grow. But the two friends go to see Ciboulette and her adorable kittens over and over, behind Dad’s back. Until… all the cats go missing!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: There is a big surprise planned for the children today! A very big surprise: a pony named Apache! The children are being given an introduction to horse and pony riding. Charley is a bit frightened in the beginning… But Jane, who knows Apache really well, will help him overcome his fears. And Charley will then have a wonderful time!

programme.title: Sam And Julia

There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Grandma offers Sam and Julia a curious calendar representing the Mouse Mansion, each numbered window revealing an apartment the way it was long ago when its inhabitant first arrived.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: There is a coal shortage at the Clay Pits. Timothy warns Bill and Ben to go easy and spare their coal. But Bill and Ben don’t listen, teasing each other, and Timothy and messing about, until they do run out of coal! Luckily Timothy runs on oil, so he manages to keep going, delivering clay to the docks and bringing back coal for the tank engine twins.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Spencer brings a Very Important Passenger from the mainland, he is so determined to be on time that he doesn’t notice he’s been sent down the wrong track. By the time he arrives at Knapford, he is very late indeed and the V.I.P. refuses to travel back with him. The other engines all compete to be chosen to take the V.I.P. back to the mainland, but rushing to do things quickly and showing off, only leads to confusion and delay. And Spencer ends up being given a second chance.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Hilda arrives at Sallys dance party, shes suddenly struck with a severe case of the sneezes. programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Its cold weather and Monkey has made a banana peel scarf for Parrot but that is not very warming or comfortable. Mole appears and tells them about sheep and her famously warm wool. programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah is excited to shadow Sergeant Rose Ravani until she gets stuck filing maps. But when Gareth and Nipper go missing in the woods, Rose leads their rescue mission

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When Franklin accidentally creates the “Forest Fuzzy”, a fun toy out of scrap materials from Aunt T’s Messy Make-It-shop, his friends fall in love with the critters and quickly makes their own versions. programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family

programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave learn some dance moves for a hoe-down on the farm. programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave

But have they won enough points to beat their jungle friends? Or will victory rest on success in the final running relay?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare tries to jump high enough to reach a last Autumn apple on a high branch. Unable to reach it, even with the help of Little Field Mouse, he gives up. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you get stuck, you need some help and then you can get down by yourself.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Trying to figure out what a strange piece of metal with a number 10 on it is, Huckle and his pals take it to Blacksmith Bear who helps them discover strange writing on it. programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is trying to sculpt in the mud but he is not able to create mud that is not too soft or hard for sculpting. programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Peter fixes Joe’s giant kite and gets it off the ground… unfortunately he also gets his feet tangled up in the string and is pulled into the air!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate is making a balloon buddy for Mim-Mim and needs a big balloon. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends find a balloon tree, but all its balloons are flat and droopy. programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate and her stuffed toy friends use their imaginations to go on wild and incredible adventures.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Picorette the hen has taken over the kids’ swing, using it as a perch. So T’choupi and Nina decide to build her a swing of her own. But getting Picorette to agree to change perches is another matter… Luckily, they’re able to coax her, with food!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi leaves the gate to the goats pen unlatched, one of the baby goats goes missing! Finding out about it, he’s anxious it might get into difficulties while out on its own. programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia sleeps badly, disturbed by a nightmare that comes back every night. In order to help her find back her sleep and her dynamism, Sam invents a trap to capture bad dreams. Will it work?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda breaks a teacup right after getting up, for Molly theres only one explanation: its Friday the 13th. At first, Tilda dismisses this as pure superstition. After several further mishaps, however, she begins to worry that maybe there is something to it. Her friends are absolutely convinced.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Turbulent invited his friend Kiko to sleep over, but in the middle of the night, the Triplets find out that he is a sleepwalker! Kiko is heading towards Mom’s room and if the kids don’t do anything he is going to wake her up and she won’t let him sleep over again. However, they cannot wake up Kiko either, it is said to be dangerous. Luckily, the Triplets manage to bring their friend back in bed. But what if he starts again? It is going to be a long long night!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets, Eliott and Toto are on their way to the park but, bad news, dogs are not allowed there! They tried to sneak in but were not able to get very far. What a shame! And it is the same story at the swimming pool, the bakery and even school: dogs are not welcome! The Triplets find it extremely unfair and decide to overlook these bans so that Toto can be part of the fun!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: It’s lovers day in the forest. While Margaret and Edmund are wondering what gifts they can give each other, Scoutbadger and Rosie are intrigued by Woodsy’s behaviour. He seems to have a secret that they are determined to disover…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou falls from his bicycle whilst out with Daddy and breaks his arm. Has to adapt to life in cast, which isnt very fun.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillous family visits an old castle, and Caillou’s inspired by an old tapestry to imagine himself as a wizard in Arthurian legend.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day two visitors come to the Island of Sodor to take pictures of interesting engines. At first Bert finds them very polite. They drive their little blue car along the line, racing ahead of him and stop to take pictures as they go past. But they don’t bother waving or saying hello and when they drive through a puddle Bert gets splashed with muddy water and decides they are very rude. He decides to get his own back by using his steam to make water rain down on them from the wet branches, but the Small Controller is not very happy with him.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: When a thunderstorm comes to Chuggington, Wilson cant control his fear!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty introduces Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to different types of musical instruments. They learn how to strum a guitar, bang a drum and blow a trumpet and a whistle, and end up making fantastic music together.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On an Australian beach, Kyle builds a sandcastle until he stumbles upon a fishing net endangering a stranded Manta Ray. Simultaneously, Leo, Katie, and Hero engage in a garden frog hunt. Hero detects a croaking sound, leading them to a frog stuck in a drain pipe. As they rescue the frog, Kyle calls Leo about the trapped Manta Ray. From the computer, they learn about Manta Rays and their need for constant motion to breathe. Racing to the beach in PlatypusOne, they find Kyle tirelessly trying to keep the Manta Ray wet. Katies knowledge about Manta Rays prompts them to prioritize putting the fish back into the water before untangling the net. Utilizing the winch, they successfully pull the Manta Ray into the sea. However, their underwater celebration is disrupted when a fake shark fin alarmingly approaches them which turns out to be Ranger Rocky. He calls Ranger Joey who educates them on Manta Rays unique features, and they try to gently remove the net, freeing the Manta Ray. In the Garden, Hero playfully chases the frog, which ends up in the drainpipe revealing Hero to be the reason the frogs are in the pipe!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play shadow tag until it starts raining and Bings shadow is outside getting wet.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Bing Bunny

When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Coco and Charlie come to play at Bings house they measure how tall he is, but when they get the measuring ritual wrong, Bing is scared hes growing down!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: On a road trip to find homes for his van full of orphan puppies, Huckleberry gets lost near Berry Bitty City and is invited by Strawberry to spend the night—but ends up staying longer to repair the damage that his frisky pups do to the marketplace bedroom! The girls each host one of the pups while Huck, grateful to the town for rescuing him, fakes interest in the girls’ activities in an attempt to get everyone to like him. Blueberry discovers his love of the same Patti Persimmon mystery novels that she loves, and encourages him to be himself. Meanwhile the girls swap puppies until each finds their perfect match and adopts one!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger is angry with Martis who prefers to play a game with Loudo. Scoutbadger hates this game and wants his friend, his very best friend, not to play it and spend more time with him.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. When the full moon is veiled in clouds, Little Nutbrown is disappointed - but is extra delighted when the clouds part to reveal a bright red moon.

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Annalee and Boribon are planning a trip, but Boribon isn’t feeling well. The little bears fever rises, and he has to stay in bed. Annalee takes care of him, so the days pass quickly. Thanks to all the care and medicine, Boribon soon gets well again!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Ella demands to be the one who decides while playing games with Sam and Julia. But her two friends think the leader should rather be the one who is the most efficient at each game...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A former resident comes back to visit the flat she used to live in when she was a child : Julias. She had forgotten there a music box. Julia has found the toy but is reluctant to give it back...

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are at the beach, and they can’t wait to go swimming!!! Unfortunately, there is a new lifeguard on the beach, and he is not the kind to let anyone have fun... The Triplets can’t either bathe, or make sandcastles, or pirouettes, or kite. What a bummer! The lifeguard whistles constantly, like a quartermaster sergeant against his soldiers. Then the Triplets are going to k really hard to escape the lifeguard and give him the hardest time, who will win this fight?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Be friend with a shark, is that even possible? Poet discovers a swimming ring shaped like a shark in the sand. He imagines being friend with a NICE shark which is tired of everyone thinking he’s bad. Turbulent and Girl take him out of his musing and ask him if he wants to join them to fish shrimps. But Poet won’t fish shrimps, no! He will find a shark and make him his new friend. He’ll bring it back to Paris where he will play with it, feed it, learn it how to brush teeth and bed it. Not sure Mommy will agree.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Eddie and Hodge are out hanging banners advertising the upcoming Tootington Tunnel Dash. Meanwhile, Jackman and Wilson are out doing some advanced special rescue training. Eddie abseils off Border Bridge to attach a huge banner - he gets caught in it and is stuck dangling from the bridge. On the tracks below, Koko and Hanzo hear his calls for help. Koko rushes off to find Chug Patrol. Jackman and Wilson race to the scene and attempt to reach Eddie. Jackman lowers his winch, but can’t see what he’s doing and just can’t get to Eddie.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Peter fixes Joe’s giant kite and gets it off the ground… unfortunately he also gets his feet tangled up in the string and is pulled into the air!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Wildmen of Pontypandy are trying to carry a massive log through the woods. But when Moose tries to lighten their load by floating the log in the river, he gets swept up and dragged downstream towards the waterfall!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: When Dad catches a cold, Kate wants to help him feel better. In Mimiloo, Gobble and Tack have caught a bug too…the giggle bugs! Kate and Mim-Mim must find the cure: merry berry bush berries. The bush will only release berries if they make it laugh, but Mim-Mim’s jokes aren’t funny. He’ll have to tickle its funny bone another way!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: A family camp-out in the backyard has Kate both excited and nervous—she’s never slept outside before. In Mimiloo, she and Mim-Mim find Boomer with a case of the hiccups! The only cure is to scare the hiccups away with a journey to Happy Hollow—a place that’s supposed to be full of spooky creatures! Will it work?

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou wants to play T-ball instead of helping his family with spring cleaning, a fantasy about being a player on a famous (but selfish) baseball team during the World Baseball Finals shows him that teamwork is the best approach.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou and Clementine find a tiger toy at school, they are reluctant to look for its owner and give it back. By pretending to be a safari guide who finds a baby tiger separated from his mother, Caillou realizes that it’s not right to keep things that don’t belong to you, no matter how much you love them.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day while repairing an embankment, Marion strikes something hard and insists it must be the mast of a Viking Ship. It looks like a water pipe to Thomas but Marion is adamant that it isn’t. But the next day Thomas notices flooding near the bank and then there is a landslip and Marion has to admit her mistake and help prevent an accident.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this episode, the Junior Rangers attempt to return a crab-eating macaque to the wild. Their knowledgeable friend, Ranger Rocky, assists them in their journey through the rainforest.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers take a baby smooth-coated otter to the rainforest to find its home. Unfortunately, a group of hungry crocodiles have their eyes on the little otter.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a playful young orangutan in his garden. With the orangutan in tow, the Junior Rangers travel to the Indonesian island of Sumatra to look for the orangutan’s mother.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: It’s Christmas! And everyone’s getting ready for the pantomime. Little Lucy has a wonderful song to sing at the centre of the show but when she goes missing whilst out riding on Pumpkin the horse all that matters is to find her.. and the newly fallen snow means that Pat has to be VERY resourceful in order to find her. A snowmobile saves the day and Pat gets Lucy back - in time for the Panto and a rather special Christmas Song to celebrate. ‘’Happy Christmas Greendale Village, Happy Christmas Everyone!’’

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat and Jess set out to Cornwall to take delivery of a steam engine called Old Betty.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing goes to play with Sula who is engrossed in a game of ‘sparkle magic’ when he arrives. Bing wants to play too but Sula finds all sorts of reasons why Bing can’t play with her special sparkly things. Amma suggests that Bing makes his own sparkle magic stone but disaster strikes when Bing accidentally spills Sula’s precious sparkle dust.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are in the sandpit pretending to be diggers. Bing wants to dig the biggest hole and gets upset when Pando accidentally fills it in. It takes Flop to show them how they can work together to be just like the digger men they saw planting a tree in the park earlier.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma have come to Bings house for lunch but there are no carrots so Flop pops to the shop to get some. Bing stays behind but its not long before he starts to miss Flop. Missing Flop... its a Bing thing!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch box, and Pando has the exact same one – match! At first it’s fun to match, but that changes when Bing and Pando mix their lunchboxes up and end up with the wrong lunch.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Daisy are making sticky honey buns, but Daisy doesn’t follow the recipe properly and they end up getting stuck to the dough -- and each other! -- instead. They ask Henry for help, and he ends up getting stuck as well. The three then head through Big City, and everyone they meet somehow ends up getting stuck, too. But when they think that it couldn’t get much worse, it starts to rain! Oswald suddenly realises that they can become unstuck by standing in the rain and sure enough the sticky dough gets washed away.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Pongo the Friendly Dragon is sad because he doesn’t have anyone his size to play with and can’t enjoy activities like riding on the seesaw. Feeling sorry for his friend, Oswald finds the perfect match for Pongo - Laverne the White Elephant - but Pongo is too shy to say hello to her. Oswald devises ways to get them together, but the clumsy Pongo keeps ruining his efforts. Finally Oswald manoeuvres both Pongo and Laverne into the basket of a hot-air balloon and sets them adrift, and they float off together, friends at last.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Jenny Dobbs commissions Bob and team to build Komodo Island with a walkway/bridge for the public to gain a better view of the Komodo Dragons. Muck discovers he is terrified of the Komodos so is set to work clearing out their old enclosure (without his knowledge) instead. When he discovers some eggs buried in the earth there he braves returning to the Island to ask Jenny what to do with them. But a Komodo hisses at him and Muck is spooked - he backs into part of the walkway causing it to collapse and leaving Leo dangling in mid air from a safety harness. When Muck sees the Komodo apparently climbing the tree to attack Leo he overcomes his fears to go back and save him.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s the Machine’s Check Up Day; a day when Curtis the mechanic comes to check their mechanics and engines are all working properly! Scoop boast he’s going to get ‘top marks’ for his check-up. Lofty is worried he won’t get any. After Scoop, Lofty and Muck have a Jet-Wash, Bob calls Curtis to tell him they’re ready but Scoop realises his orange emergency light is broken and thinks he won’t get ‘top marks’. He panics and decides to hide until Curtis has gone! Scoop scours the Yard for somewhere to hide – but in the process makes himself muddy again. Then he breaks the glass in his side mirror before tearing his rear tyre mud flap. Eventually Bob finds Scoop hiding behind a pile of cement bags, looking dishevelled and sorry for himself! Bob and Wendy ‘fix’ Scoop so he’s ready for his check-up. Lofty is still worried and nervous about being examined.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare makes a slippery slide from a pile of snow and has so much fun he decides to keep it a secret and play with it all by himself. But he soon gets bored playing by himself, and invites his friends to play. They build bigger and curvier slides together and slide faster and faster. Little Nutbrown Hare learns it’s lots more fun to shares the joy with his friends.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After Big Nutbrown Hare shows Little Nutbrown Hare a special place where his voice echoes, he and Little Field Mouse play a game of Try to find me with Little Redwood Fox and Little Grey Squirrel. They hide in the ravine and as their voices bounce off the rocky walls, their friends have a very tricky time trying to find them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare, Little Field Mouse and Big Nutbrown Hare go up to high meadow with Big Nutbrown Hare they get caught in the mist. It’s a little scary so they hold hands and pass the time by playing guessing games. As the mist starts to lift, they see a beautiful circle rainbow around the sun.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class are learning about music. Can you guess what instruments they are playing?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to prove to Pig Will and Pig Won’t that the figure they saw wearing a strange yellow suit and helmet is not a spaceman from another planet. The clues finally lead them to the realization that it was really Granny Goodpig wearing her yellow suit to protect her while she collected honey from her beehives./ Someone took all the red roses from Granny Goats garden leaving Huckle and gang puzzled.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, it’s Christmas Eve and Messy is just too excited. He can’t wait for Christmas day and wants to stay awake all night. He wonders why he has to go to sleep at all, so he goes to Okido to find out. When he lands in Okido he finds Zoe and Felix can’t sleep either, they’re just too excited for Mother Christmas to arrive. But wait “Mother Christmas… what kind of Christmas is this?” asks Messy. Zoe and Felix pull out their Okido Christmas story book and show Messy what happens at Christmas in Okido.
